summary:
# Scaling and Zone-redundant Application Gateway v2

This documentation introduces the scaling and zone-redundant features of Azure Application Gateway v2 and WAF v2 SKUs. 

## Autoscaling

Autoscaling allows the Application Gateway and WAF v2 SKUs to scale out or in based on application traffic requirements. This mode offers better elasticity and eliminates the need to manually configure the gateway size or instance count. Autoscaling also helps save costs by running the gateway at peak-provisioned capacity only when required. 

To enable autoscaling, you need to specify a minimum instance count. This ensures that the gateway doesn't fall below the specified count, even without traffic. Each instance is roughly equivalent to 10 reserved Capacity Units. You can also specify a maximum instance count to limit the scaling. The instance count can range from 0 to 125, with a default maximum of 10 if not specified. You are billed only for the traffic served by the gateway.

## Manual Scaling

Alternatively, you can choose the manual mode where the gateway doesn't autoscale. In this mode, you must specify the instance count, which can vary from 1 to 125 instances. If the traffic exceeds the capacity of the gateway, it may result in traffic loss.

## Autoscaling and High Availability

Azure Application Gateways are always deployed in a highly available fashion. The service consists of multiple instances that are created based on the configuration or application load. Even with autoscaling and zero minimum instances, the service remains highly available.

To minimize downtime during instance creation, it is recommended to configure a minimum instance count of two, ideally with availability zone support. This ensures that there is at least one functional instance to handle traffic while a new instance is being created. An instance can support around 10 Capacity Units, so consider configuring the minimum instance autoscaling setting higher than two depending on your traffic patterns.

During scale-in events, existing connections are drained for 5 minutes on the instance being removed. After 5 minutes, the instance is removed and any new connections are established with other existing instances on the same gateway.

## Next Steps

- [Schedule autoscaling for Application Gateway](application-gateway-externally-managed-scheduled-autoscaling.md)
- [Learn more about Application Gateway v2](overview-v2.md)
- [Create an autoscaling, zone redundant application gateway with a reserved virtual IP address using Azure PowerShell](tutorial-autoscale-ps.md)
